intro: Oxyrhynchus papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan oxyrhynchus, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, often emerging from the base of the plant. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Oxyrhynchus papuanus is adapted to the tropical and subtropical environments of its native habitat, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
